abstracts.cdata!:
The Financial Sector Adjustment Program
            Project, will support a comprehensive program of financial
            sector reform, currently implemented by the Government of
            Colombia. The main objectives will be to support: a)
            required changes in financial sector legislation, and
            regulations, to facilitate strengthening of bank
            supervision, and deposit insurance, and, to promote
            efficient resolution of banks facing financial solvency
            problems; b) the institutional capacity strengthening of the
            Superintendency of Banks, and the Bank Deposit Insurance and
            Resolution Agency for Financial Institutions, entity
            responsible for deposit insurance, and bank resolution; c)
            restructuring, re-capitalization, privatization, and, if
            necessary, liquidation of state-owned, and
            "officialized" banks, currently under public
            sector management; and, d) effective implementation of
            special measures to address the immediate impact on the
            financial system, stemming from economic, or other
            emergencies. Co-financing is expected from the
            Inter-American Development Bank, and, the Corporacion Andina
            de Fomento, to support the financial sector reform program.
            There are risks affecting the transition of the financial
            system, though the proposed program emphasizes that,
            financial structural reforms, and efficient resolution of
            credit institutions, will help minimize the risks of a
            systemic crisis.
